results.title: Diagnosis of speech and reading problems
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates various tests that the teacher can use to evaluate a student’s neurological development. These include visual pursuit, cortical dominance, cross-pattern creeping, and similar procedures. Slow-motion scenes and freeze frames enhance the value of this training film. (Teacher education)

results.title: Diagnosis and planning adjustment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Counselling Adolescents”.
A dramatization of an incident showing a counsellor’s diagnosis and treatment of a maladjusted student’s emotional problem is used in explaining the role of the counsellor in the over-all school program. Describes the steps in successful counselling - determining the cause of the problem, easing the student’s anxieties and strain, planning courses of action, and assisting the student in making new adjustments.

results.title: Diagnosing group operations
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Uses demonstrations and discussion to consider the causes of problems that arise in groups: signs of conflict, withdrawal, factionalism, and group indecision, along with their crippling effect on the life of the group. Explains how to identify symptoms of group problems.

results.title: Diabolo Menthe = Peppermint Soda
results.brief_description:
Kurys’ autobiographical first feature is an account of a year in the lives of two sisters - 13-year-old, introverted Anne, and outgoing 15-year-old Frederique - in the early 1960s. Avoiding sentimentality and nostalgia, the film charts the oppressions of a dreary, authoritarian school and the girls’ difficult relationships with their parents (a separated Jewish couple), their friends and each other. Awards: Prix Louis Delluc 1977. Also available on VHS in the National Collection.

Credits: Producer, Serge Laski ; director, writer, Diane Kurys ; photography, Philippe Rousselot ; music, Yves Simon.
Cast: Eleonore Klarwein, Odile Michel, Anouk Ferjak, Michel Puterflam, Yves Renier.

results.title: Diabolique
results.creator_credit: Morgan Creek, Marvin Worth, James G. Robinson and Jerremiah Chechik
results.brief_description: Jeremiah Chechik’s remake of the French classic, “Les Diaboliques” by Henri-Georges Clouzot, didn’t quite receive the acclaim of the original. Sharon Stone and Isabelle Adjani star as Nicole and Mia, the long suffering lover and wife of the cruel and manipulative headmaster Guy (Chazz Palminteri). Nicole is angry at being taken for granted and Mia, who suffers from a heart problem, is suicidal over her husband’s infidelity. Together they devise a foolproof scheme to rid their lives of Guy and all seems to have gone to plan until events occur that indicate Guy has survived. Hot on his tail is a disgruntled cop, Kathy Bates, who is sympathetic to the women’s situation but also eager to discover the truth.

results.title: Diablo is done for (NP)
results.creator_credit: Calypso Films, Dept Health and Community Services, Denise Patience and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: This is a drama about child sexual abuse. All is not right at Ray’s home where he is no longer able to tolerate his father’s sexual abuse of his young brother Mikey. With the support of his friends and teacher, Ray finally takes a stand against his father. This is a non-explicit film about child sexual abuse suitable for secondary students.

results.title: Diabetes: not so sweet!
results.creator_credit: Australian Diabetes Foundation, Geoff Owen-Taylor and Gary Cuttris
results.brief_description: A comprehensive look at diabetes. In particular, a look at symptoms, causes, complications, care skills and diet. A number of specialists are interviewed regarding research. Various case studies are also shown.

results.title: Diabetes - Looking After Yourself
results.brief_description: Presented by Katrina Lee, this video is designed to help people with mature onset diabetes to look after themselves. It answers the question - What is Diabetes? - and describes preventative measures such as improved diet and food care.

results.title: Diabetes
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Milan Chvostek
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Various researchers explain the nature of diabetes; it differs when it attacks children and adults.A mother and daughter comment on the effect the illness has on the latter and how through family and outside support she copes with it. An adult man discusses his illness and Dr. Best explains, with the help of old photographs, how he and Dr. Banting discovered insulin - which we see being manufactured.
